attributes.action: Make people with long-term medical conditions exempt from paying for medication
attributes.background: I am a young person suffering with a long term medical condition, there are many other people like me that need medication to prevent them from getting unwell. Due to medical exemption guidelines set out by the NHS Business Authority, we are having to pay £8.60 per prescription for key medications.
attributes.additional_details:
This feels immoral to me on the NHS Business Authorities' part as it is NOT MY FAULT that I have a long term medical condition as it was something I was born with. Yet, people like me are having to suffer financially when the UK has a National Health Service which is supposed to help people like me! 

Please help me in my fight for fairness! Please grant medical exemption for paying for prescriptions to people with long term medical conditions such as cardiac problems!

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage for under 25's so it is equal and fair for all
attributes.background: For people who are aged 25 and over the minimum wage is £7.83 in 2018 yet if you are below the age of 25, even if just by one year, then you are entitled to less. The younger you are the less money you get. Same job, same hours but someone is going to be paid less based on their age.
attributes.additional_details: As said previously a person aged 25 and over will be paid £7.83p/h, a 21 to 24 year old will be paid £7.38 an hour. If aged between 18 and 20 you will receive £5.90p/h and finally, if you are a school leaver or in college under the age of 18 you will only recieve £4.20. The cost of living does not depend on your age so why should your wages? This is a form of discrimination which needs to change so everyone can have a good start in life but a majority of companies play by these guidelines.

attributes.action: Refund visa fees when rejected
attributes.background: We want the government to stop charging people for visas they do not receive. The current policy is to make the visa applicant pay for the visa upfront and then keep the money when the visa is refused. This is immoral, unjust and scandalous.
attributes.additional_details: My wife's visa was refused for financial reasons when I have earned £29,500 this year and the Home Office didn't believe it to be a genuine relationship when I have lived with her in Chile for 12 months and she has lived with me in the UK for 12 months. Considering the amount of money and time it takes to apply for a visa and the length of time an appeal will take the government should ask for further information if needed. The governments visa website is misleading and inaccurate.

attributes.action: Create a register of people banned from keeping animals in the UK
attributes.background: Bans on keeping animals are currently unenforcible as no national register exists. This petition argues that a national register should be created listing all individuals who have been convicted of animal cruelty and banned from keeping animals.
attributes.additional_details: I would like to see a government website created that breeders and pet shops can use to search a database of people banned from keeping animals this is the only way we  can stop these convicted people from purchasing and possibly neglecting another  animal!

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to carry pillion passengers on a moped.
attributes.background: Let's put a stop to rising criminal offences including acid attacks, mobile phone theft, handbag theft and other crimes aided by mopeds which are far easier to carry out when carrying pillion passengers. Motorbikes over 50cc to be exempt.

attributes.action: Ban Mobile Phones on School Grounds
attributes.background: Our children are struggling at school. They are distracted by the thrill of social media via their mobile device. This must stop so why allow them to take the device onto school grounds?  If they have a problem at school, or we need to contact them urgently, we should go via the school office.
attributes.additional_details:
Not allowing them to take their devices to school would promote their conversational skills (they would be forced to talk to one another), allow them to focus more on their lessons, stop contact with parents during the day (we are busy with work and do not need the worry) and reduce online bullying.

It’s about time the UK Government woke up to this epidemic of device use at school and started to realise what effect it is having on the working force of tomorrow.  Let’s do something now!

attributes.action: Allow all people with vitamin D deficiency to receive free prescriptions.
attributes.background: A large section of the population will be affected due to the lack of sunshine and genetic make up. Vitamin D acts like a hormone and every cell in the body has a receptor for it, without it there are many symptoms and conditions that can occur.
attributes.additional_details: There are many conditions and symptoms of being Vitamin D deficient. Those with more melanin are at an instant disadvantage living in the UK. In order for these individuals to maintain their health, they have to bear the brunt of the cost and if they are to remain in the UK, this will be an expediture for thier lifetime. If a persons genetic make up renders them more vulnerable and this genetic make up exists within large sectors of the public, surely this should be handled as a social issue.

attributes.action: Introduce a South African Vulnerable Persons' Resettlement Programme
attributes.background:
- 1,700 people have been killed in farm attacks in two decades 
- In 2016/17 torture was used in 17.6% of murders 
- the South African Parliament decided in Feb to approve a motion in favour of “the expropriation of [white-owned] land without compensation”.
attributes.additional_details:
- In 2014 Britain established the Syrian Vulnerable Person Resettlement Programme (VPRP). Since June 2017 all those admitted to the UK under the VPRP have been granted refugee status. 
- We therefore merely call for equal treatment by the British government for South Africa.”

attributes.action: Regulate supported housing and hostels.
attributes.background: We need a regulatory body to license and oversee hostels and supported housing, including checking that support workers are trained, checking that licence agreements are fair, and offering a fair and impartial complaints procedure. Currently, owners get away with treating vulnerable adults unfairly.
attributes.additional_details: Vulnerable people can find it difficult to understand their rights and make complaints. Proper regulation would mean that vulnerable people would be protected without having to fight to be treated fairly. I have been discriminated against and there was nothing I could do about it. A housing charity evicted me for not engaging enough, even though I have a severe anxiety disorder and another didn't deal with a complaint fairly and wasn't impartial.

attributes.action: Grant student mothers the same protections as working mothers
attributes.background: Flexible working, maternity leave and nursing facilities are examples of protected provisions available to workers. Student mothers are just as vulnerable to maternity discrimination, yet these protections are seldom extended to them.This blind-spot has led to avoidable adversity and exclusion.
attributes.additional_details:
Education institutions are required under employment law to make maternity provisions for working mothers, yet there is no legal requirement ensuring that the same rights are extended to students who are mothers.

In spite of the Equality Act 2010, the rights of student mothers are primarily determined at their institution's discretion. Student mothers are easily marginalised and often squeezed out of the education system as a result. This must change.

attributes.action: Get the Government to fund the completion of the new Royal Liverpool Hospital.
attributes.background: The new Royal Liverpool University Hospital stands incomplete because of the collapse of Carillion. Government intervention and the allocation of public funds would enable the swift completion of the new hospital so that patients and NHS staff get the hospital the people of Merseyside deserve.
attributes.additional_details: Our new hospital stands idle and incomplete thanks to the collapse of Carillion. The Government should intervene as a matter of urgency and take direct action, including the allocation of public funds, to ensure the hospital’s completion. It is grossly wrong that patients and NHS staff should have to put up with the old hospital, which is falling into disrepair and demonstrably impacting on patient care.

attributes.action: Create a minimum free-to-carry hand luggage allowance for all UK-bound flights.
attributes.background:
Airlines are constantly removing luggage allowances. It started as hold luggage, and now carriers are removing hand luggage allowances too. 

Luggage is an essential part of flying. Being required to pay for it is unfair on the consumers.
attributes.additional_details:
Ryanair has started charging even for hand luggage. It's likely other carriers will follow suit. 

Consumers have no protection from these practices, and ultimately are forced into paying the fees, as a hand luggage allowance is essential to most people when flying. 

The aim of this petition is to encourage the government to make a minimum requirement of free-to-carry hand luggage for flights in/outbound of the UK, so consumers are not forced to pay for every essential thing when flying.

attributes.action: Legalise bow hunting in the UK
attributes.background:
I am petitioning as a fellow bowman to relegalise bow hunting. It has been a skillful way of supplying meat since the ancient times.

But now, in the UK, it is all done by guns, and bows are no longer legal. There is neither any explanation as to why it is illegalised. But we can change that.
attributes.additional_details:
The difference between guns and bows are as follows;
Bullets can get lost in your game, only to be found painfully when eating the game - Arrows get taken out soon after game is caught.
Guns are loud, scaring the animal before it dies - Bows are not as loud, if without silencers, still allowing a more humane hunt.
Gun fumes and bullet/shell remains are pollutable - Arrows are collected if found.
Bows are lighter but more convenient to that of loading a gun, which emmits noise.

attributes.action: Fine MPs for the non-disclosure of outside earnings and benefits
attributes.background: Following the 30-day suspension of an MP for the non-disclosure of two luxury holidays valued at up to £100,000, the House of Commons should change its rules to allow MPs to be fined half the value of everything they fail to properly disclose. This would improve compliance and public trust.

attributes.action: Mandatory invisible disability signs to be displayed in highly populated areas
attributes.background: my son is 5 yrs old, non verbal autistic, who's behaviour can be hard and unpredictable at times, especially on public transport where we have had to explain his behaviour and rude comments made about him. physical disabilities don't have to be explained so why should invisible ones?
attributes.additional_details:
hidden and mental disabilities should be recognised equal to those with physical disabilities. no one should have to justify their actions because of their disability. signs should be put in restaurants, on public transport, in schools and play parks etc and any other public places with large volumes of people ...
stop people thinking children with additional needs are naughty by raising awareness.

attributes.action: Make an insurance on the car itself instead of the individuals who drive it
attributes.background: The insurance in many countries like Portugal, Poland or America is made on car itself instead of individuals who drive it. This would make it easier for everyone as people will be able to drive the car even if they are not its owner and will not pay huge amounts for borrowing it.
attributes.additional_details:
In the Portugal the road traffic fatalities are decreasing with each year as young people can learn to drive with their parents car. In the 2010, there was 937 road traffic fatalities and through 5 years it has decreased to 593.
Making this change in the country will allow people to save more money on the insurances and will allow young people to drive and learn on their parents car without buying separate insurance, which can cost a lot.

attributes.action: Outlaw an expiry date on Gift Vouchers.
attributes.background: I had a gift card from a well known resturant chain. When I redeemed the card I was shocked to find that the resturant refused to honour it saying it was out of date.

attributes.action: Make ADHD part of the blue badge scheme
attributes.background: Autism and physical disabilities are included in the blue badge scheme but people don’t understand how hard it is to catch public transport and make your journey with an ADHD child!! When they have a set routine and you miss your bus ADHD is just a challenge as any other disability.
attributes.additional_details: I believe if ADHD children got accepted for a blue badge it would help a lot of families . Like less melt downs, less late trips or making shopping easier. Nothing is worse than having errands to do and your child is kicking off because you are 10 minutes late home and they have a certain routine.

attributes.action: Free school meals for everyone including secondary school students.
attributes.background: Many parents work extremely hard whilst caring for their children and lunch fees can become expensive, especially when the number of children they have increase. So free school meals can help them save money and maintain the family.

attributes.action: Make Sileby Train station more accessible.
attributes.background: Our community wants better access to Sileby train station so that wheelchair users, individuals who have mobility issues and individuals who have children in pushchairs. There are many steps going up to the platform. Therefore wheelchairs, pushchairs and those who cannot manage steps cannot access.

attributes.action: Amend the Official Secrets Act to prevent its use in cases of child abuse.
attributes.background: The Official Secrets Act may have deterred people from whistleblowing on paedophiles in positions of power. This is contrary to the public interest. We call on the Government to amend the Act to ensure that it can’t happen again.
attributes.additional_details:
There seem to have been moves to cover up cases of child abuse in order to protect people in power from accusations. This is evidenced by the Interview former chief whip Tim Fortescue gave to Panorama in 1995.
 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/av/28207066/abuse-claims-senior-whip-would-help-colleagues
 
I have campaigned on this issue for 30+ years

attributes.action: Legislate to ensure all future England football matches are 'free to air'
attributes.background:
The excitement, drama, joy & pain of being an England supporter has been made so evident to a new generation. 

We should encourage those fans to hold their interest in the wonderful game and allow TV licence paid access for all of them and us diehards too. 

No satellite/cable//other fee needed
attributes.additional_details:
Euro 2020 Final is at Wembley on 12th July 2020.

Let us be there all the way.

It's coming home!

This wiki about OfCom, the Broadcasting Act 1996 & subsequent Regulations shows only that only the finals for Euro 2020 are covered and that all other qualifying matches/friendlies will be pay per view or subscription. 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ofcom_Code_on_Sports_and_Other_Listed_and_Designated_Events

attributes.action: Mandatory right for substance misuse clients to have an independent advocate
attributes.background: We want it to be a statutory right for people with substance misuse issues to have access to an independent advocate, like other types of patients in the Mental Health Act 2010. We feel this will allow dual diagnosis clients who can't access mental health services better access to support networks.
attributes.additional_details:
50% of people with severe mental health issues have substance misuse issues.
37% of alcohol abusers have a mental health issue.
53% of drug users also have mental health issues.
These people cant access independent advocates through the mental health act because mental health services want these people to deal with their addictions before they commence treatment for mental health.

Figures from Helpguide.org

attributes.action: Make ‘Settled Application’ free for EU citizens
attributes.background:
There are about 2.9 million EU citizens living in the UK, the majority of whom came to the UK in good faith and are hard working taxpayers. 

We feel it a stab in the back to make them pay for acquiring 'settled' status. Why should they be the victims of brexit, when they had no say in the matter?

attributes.action: An NHS follow up for those suffering from mental health
attributes.background: I want anyone with depression in their medical history, to have a home visit from a professional, regularly. Access to support groups in every town. To deliver anti-depressants to their home. To signpost them to charitable organizations available.
attributes.additional_details:
For those affected to have access to a free gym membership, healthy food delivered to their door and an annual trip to a concert/show/item of interest. A postal scheme whereby every month leaflets about mental health and how to get help are posted through every door in the United Kingdom and for these to be displayed in every room in every NHS service available to both the public and professionals.
It is said that 1 in 4 people currently suffer from depression in the United Kingdom alone, 6188 have taken their own lives in 2017. It is time to make a change.

attributes.action: If a person uses a vehicle as a weapon they should receive a lifetime ban
attributes.background: If a person gets into a vehicle and ultimately uses that vehicle as a weapon then they should get an automatic lifetime ban from driving on top of any convictions that the courts see fit to administer.
attributes.additional_details:
It is quickly becoming a new trend for people to jump into a vehicle and drive it into a crowd, this is a problem on several fronts including terrorism. 

The courts deal with the criminal aspect by handing out custodial sentences, however when the convicted party leaves prison they are allowed to reapply for a licence or continue driving as the bans handed out are normally spent whilst in prison.

If these offenders were convicted of Animal Cruelty they would receive a lifetime ban.

attributes.action: Don't Abolish the House of Lords!
attributes.background: The House of Lords is a great parliamentary asset. Having a body that checks the Commons while being outside of the electoral process prevents rivalry and keeps the system balanced!
attributes.additional_details: If we had an elected Senate in place of the Lords, it would simply rival the Commons. Fundamentally, in elected office, politicians must make promises that pander to voters to keep them elected. The House of Lords doesn't have to fear electoral defeat because they have lifelong tenure and can focus on getting the job done of checking policy! They don't need to be accountable; that's what we have the Commons for whose power is the greatest of the two houses!

attributes.action: Reduce Foreign Aid budget to 0.5% of GDP
attributes.background: I propose we reduce the Foreign Aid budget to 0.5% of GDP then put those savings into NHS, Policing, Armed Forces, Schools & Infra-structure in equal proportions.
attributes.additional_details:
We currently put 0.7% of our GDP into Foreign Aid, which is ok when we can afford it but the needs of our Country must come first.
It is the duty of the Government to put the security of the nation first that means increasing the funding for our Armed Forces.
It is also the duty of our Government to ensure the safety of its people that means increasing the funding for our Police.
Until our Road networks are repaired, our Hospitals upgraded, our schools rebuilt and our Police and Armed Forces are fully equipped to defend our Nation the reduce Foreign Aid Budget should remain.
Once we have rebuilt these vital services we can once again increase our Foreign Aid budget on the understanding that it is fully audited and overseen by our Armed Forces, that way we can see how our money is spent

attributes.action: New law so that mobile suppliers cannot change the terms of contracts
attributes.background: I believe contracts should be honoured. As a consumer I do not have the right to change the terms of the contract after a purchase. I want a new law to state that mobile phone companies cannot change the terms of a contract without the consent of the other party to the contract.
attributes.additional_details: In March, I renewed my SIM-only contract because it offered free roaming in Turkey at no additional cost. Within a few weeks they contacted me to say that free roaming in Turkey is no longer included in my contract and would cost £6 a day to use my phone there. My wife also took out a contract a couple of weeks after me with the same belief that we could use our phones in Turkey for no fee.

attributes.action: Transfer the responsibility of A422 Brackley - Banbury to Highways England
attributes.background: The section of the A422 between Brackley and Banbury is used quite heavily by all forms of transport at the moment the road is under Northamptonshire Highways, and not Highways England, plans for a Farthinghoe By Pass have yet to materialise.
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment the road is closed for a small bridge repair near Farthinghoe.
Which  is causing chaos with minor roads unsuitable for use of high traffic volumes. The road is also a diversion route for M40 Traffic from Junction 10 to 11 vice versa when road accidents occur on the motorway between those junctions.

attributes.action: Stop/ reduce the financial requirement in immigration -It's breaking up families
attributes.background: Financial requirements are too high and minimum wage is too low. Lower the financial criteria to minimum wage or get rid of it. Families are being broken by the Home Office as they are deporting genuine family members out of the UK and creating skype families.
attributes.additional_details: You need to earn £18,600 for a spouse visa. When there's a child involved and the member of the family has no working rights, the financial criteria is impossible to reach. It’s destroying lives and making people mentally ill.

attributes.action: Ensure all schools offer reception children a full time education from September
attributes.background: Every September many schools accept reception children for only part of a day for up to 6 weeks, causing enormous difficulties for many parents. Working parents have to take leave, unpaid leave in the case of self-employed parents, or pay huge childcare costs while the phased start is in place
attributes.additional_details:
There is little awareness of a ruling by the Schools Adjudicator in 2013 who said, in reference to phased starts, “It is not permissible in my view for a school to deny a child a term of full-time education. The school has a duty to provide a full-time place from September and cannot refuse to do so.”

The latest school admissions code supports this, stating that a local authority must make clear that children are entitled to a full-time place in the Sept following their fourth birthday.

attributes.action: Make parental alienation a criminal offence
attributes.background: Parental alienation should be included in the definition of the offence of Controlling or Coercive Behaviour. The current offence doesn’t include control through children such as changing arrangements and no shows.

attributes.action: a maximum amount to be specified for school uniforms
attributes.background: School uniforms are now ridiculously expensive and even primarily schools are now setting excessive rules on school uniforms.  Parents are effectively paying hundreds of pounds in “fees” just to send a child to school.  Parents should not have pay for these excessive uniforms
attributes.additional_details: Schools should be ordered to set a maximum amount of £50 for the whole uniform and any costs in excess of this must be bourne by the school.  This would also prevent schools from selecting one supplier who can then dictate the price people pay.  As education is mandatory parents should not be forced into paying excessive amounts just to send a child to school

attributes.action: Force all new build house purchases to have a retainer on purchase agreements.
attributes.background: More new build houses are being built each day. Problems with new builds are soaring and NHBC warranties is not enough to protect buyers. Developers should be force to accept retainer agreements from purchasers to protect them against nightmare builds, retaining part of funds until work is completed
attributes.additional_details: I am a new build homeowner. 8 months in to date. We have suffered unimaginable losses financially and also mentally due to a nightmare build. We have had drains incorrectly installed, we have a house that does not have building control sign off and we are still no where near getting our house right. I live on a street where 10 other residents also have houses that are not signed off from building control, yet we are living in these houses. The system is very very broken and people are suffering.

attributes.action: Bring Welfare Assessments back to the DWP and scrap contracts with providers
attributes.background: There are widespread reports of Capita producing PIP and ESA assessments that are inaccurate, contain factual errors and ignore important evidence. There are too many appeals being lost by the DWP because of Capita's incompetence.
attributes.additional_details: People are being made seriously ill as a result of the appalling record of Capita’s assessments. It seems Capita make headlines about errors and omissions in all their govt contracts but the most serious is their atrocious record in Welfare assessments.

attributes.action: Oppose the death penalty for IS 'Beatles' duo
attributes.background: Whatever the crime, the UK government must oppose the death penalty as a matter of principle. A letter leaked to the Telegraph shows that the UK government would seek no assurances about the sentences of Alexanda Kotey and El Shafee Elsheikh if the pair were extradited to the US.

attributes.action: Re-introduce National Service
attributes.background: For the good of the country and it’s people, bring back National Service.

attributes.action: Brexit re article 50 it must not be suspended/stopped under any circumstances
attributes.background: the full details are well known to everyone the media has covered it fully
attributes.additional_details: the british people MUST be given the Brexit they voted for anything else is not acceptable to the british public  ARTICLE 50 must not under any circumstances be hindered/suspended/stopped for any reason whatsoever  the time is here to take action as there has been excessive feet dragging/delaying tactics by those opposed to brexit

attributes.action: Make it a requirement that airlines provide carbon emissions information.
attributes.background: At the moment, many people take flights without realising the environmental impact of their actions. Without information on this, it is difficult to begin to raise awareness of this problem. Carbon emissions information when you book a flight would be a good start.

attributes.action: Urge the Nigerian Government to protect civilians
attributes.background: Nigeria is a former colony and protectorate of the Imperial British Empire. Now it is an independent nation. There is a general insecurity fuelled by violence and killings. Action is required now to protect the Nigerian people and bring peace to the country.

attributes.action: Amend the PPERA 2000 to ban all foreign donations at all times
attributes.background:
The UK currently allows foreigners to donate to political causes and campaigns. The PPERA allows this outside of election campaigns, which gives foreign money undue influence in United kingdom political life.

The PPERA 2000 should be amended to ban all such at all times

attributes.action: Raise the definition of a child in the Mental Health Act to from 16 to 18.
attributes.background: Parents of 16 year old children held under the Mental Health Act cannot find out how they’re coping. The staff are unable to share any information on the children. Children under 18 are unable to keep themselves safe, so 16 to 18 year olds should be classified as children under the Act.

attributes.action: Get compensation from the Government for the Immigration (Windrush) Victims
attributes.background: The people who have been threatened with deportation, who have lost wages and jobs and the stress of having to apply for citizenship in a country (GB) where they understood they had a right to stay. The Government has not kept the records pre-1973. That is a failure on the Government's part .
attributes.additional_details: I have lived here for 61 years, worked, paid tax, married, passed my driving test etc.  I was never questioned re my Canadian birth cert, I arrived here on my mother's Passport as she returned to England after my Fathers death in Canada 1956. My father fought in the last world war as a volunteer. I have always known I had an independent right to stay. I have now had to apply for citizenship, been stopped from working for 15 months. Loss of earnings is debilitating. I am stressed out and angry.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of pencil sharpeners with easy release blades.
attributes.background: Many young adults these days with the pressures of school, friends and social media struggle at times and sadly turn to self-harm. As a parent you can hide all the sharp cutting items in your house only to find your child using the removable blade from a pencil sharpener.
attributes.additional_details: How is that an under 18 can’t go and buy a knife, razor or anything with a blade but can go and buy a pencil sharpener which has a removable blade? There’s even a video on YouTube that shows you how to remove it although it is only a tiny screw holding it in so it’s not rocket science! To ban all under 18s buying one is not perceivable but I do believe they could be manufactured differently such as having a non-tamper screw. If the Government bans those where the blade is easy to release, industry will follow with a safer product. Something has to be done.

attributes.action: Have GMT all year round.
attributes.background:
An extra hour in bed every day for six months of the year.

The correct time for our longitude.

attributes.action: Make emotional abuse and bullying a criminal offence
attributes.background: Unless there has been a threat of violence, nothing can be done to stop emotional abuse. This seriously affects mental health. This is a major problem for ex-partners and their children. Emotional abuse should be illegal.
attributes.additional_details: It is also not possible for someone to leave their job for bullying and to go onto job seeker's allowance despite this affecting their mental health due to this not currently being seen as an issue.

attributes.action: Parliament debate on the Right of Reply of people attacked in daily newspapers
attributes.background: It is intolerable and unfair that individuals attacked and criticised in the daily newspapers in the UK are not presently afforded the Right of Reply in said newspapers.
attributes.additional_details: I feel it is deemed necessary to debate whether individuals attacked in the UK mass media should be afforded an automatic Right of Reply to respond and the editors of the relevant newspapers should be made by law to publish those individuals replies with space afforded equal to the column size of the original articles which attacked them.

attributes.action: Integrate Physical and Mental Health
attributes.background: It seems logical, but people can have both physical and mental health problems. Yet many mental health units do not allow for or accommodate physical health needs or disabilities. It's 2018, so surely we should be able to provide care for people with complex or multiple needs...
attributes.additional_details: I am detained in a mental health unit currently, and am often unable to take leave because I use a wheelchair and the hospital drive is too steep for a manual wheelchair. Many units are unable to accommodate wheelchair users at all, and those that do often struggle to provide equal access, consistent access to physio, or other adaptations. This may mean some young people, purely because of their physical health needs, are sent to elderly mental health wards! THIS NEEDS TO CHANGE!!!

attributes.action: Introduce a benefit payment to all diagnosis of cancer patients
attributes.background: When you are diagnosed with cancer your world is turned upside down for the patient and there familys many cancer victims are off work for long periods of time with no help from the government am asking the government to provide a benefit to help them fight this awful disease and make life easier
attributes.additional_details: Cancer is a five year programme and can return at anyone point during the five years
